title: 820-00138 yellow light doesn't charge
message:
I have 820-00138 yellow light doesn't charge, 

I found few threads, having the same issue they are all closed without resolution on this forum. So I will give it another try. My board is beraly water damage. turns on with battery, when connect charger percentage jumps to 100% I tried pram reset before realizing it doesnt charge. and doesn't turn on with battery unplugged.

ISL6259 gets power
between pins
 17/18 - 4ohm
27/28 - 15 m ohm
20v PPBUS


what I think L7560 - has only 1v
if I remove coil one side has almost short 250 ohm - P3V3S5_CSN2 is that normal or is it even L7560? I removed TPS51980 and resistance hasn't change. 

1 photo of the element that had water damage. the other photo of L7560

title: 820-00138 yellow light doesn't charge
message: 20V on PPBUS doesn't worry you? 12.6V is what it should be, what is 15 m ohm? Look at diagram and tell me what the resistance should be between pins 27/28.

title: 820-00138 yellow light doesn't charge
message:
I have no idea how I got 20v yesterday sorry. I have 1.5v on L7130, I think the problem is that transistor doesn't open Q7130. from what I understand it runs by voltage difference on G and S. But U7100 pin 23 and 24 have the same voltage, resistance between pins is 23k. I replaced ISL6259 still 1.5v on both 23 and 24. any ideas?

M ohm is megaohm, I measure it again and it is 33 mohm

title: 820-00138 yellow light doesn't charge
message: I have 1.5v on L7130, I think the problem is that transistor doesn't open Q7130. from what I understand it runs by voltage difference on G and S. But U7100 pin 23 and 24 have the same voltage, resistance between pins is 23k. I replaced ISL6259 still 1.5v on both 23 and 24. any ideas?

title: 820-00138 yellow light doesn't charge
message: Tell me what resistance should be between 27, 28.

title: 820-00138 yellow light doesn't charge
message:
so just got to it today, I run jumper between pin 27(R7122) and R7120, resistance normal now 21 ohm. After plugin in power cord spark on C4696, I removed it. I still have short on L7560. after few min, green light disappear. later I figure out C7552 in short. I replaced it, after I fixed it I tried to boot macbook with battery, another usb capacitor blown sparked( first c4696). all three capacitors are on PP5V_S4_REG, started blowing for some reason.

PPBUS_G3H voltage increased to 4v. L7560 1.8v I tried to apply 1v to PP3V3_S5_REG as a result U1100 get warm, am I up to sth or it is just first thing to get warm and I have another big capacitor in short?.
I am really stuck here, Duke any ideas on how to go about this one?

title: 820-00138 yellow light doesn't charge
message: Seems like the 5V bus went high and fried stuff. What is resistance to GND on 3v3_s5 now?

title: 820-00138 yellow light doesn't charge
message: Yeah this is toast, I bet the PCH got fried and everything else on this bus.
